title: Palace of Rokan Hulu
text:
The Palace of Rokan Hulu (known in Indonesian as Istana Rokan Hulu) is located in the <a href="List%20of%20regencies%20and%20cities%20of%20Indonesia">regency</a> of <a href="Rokan%20Hulu">Rokan Hulu</a>, <a href="Riau">Riau</a> province, <a href="Sumatra">Sumatra</a>, <a href="Indonesia">Indonesia</a>.
The wooden palace is approximately two hundred years old and was constructed by the Rokan Hulu kingdom, a small kingdom of the <a href="Malays%20%28ethnic%20group%29">Malayu</a> people. It was the residence of the <a href="sultan">sultan</a> and his family.
The building is notable not only as a relic of this lost kingdom but also due to its architecture. The palace features some outstanding examples of traditional wood-carving. It follows the traditional design of an old, Malayu 'rumah tinggi' house, with a soaring roof and a projecting porch. The palace is now protected as a <a href="National%20Monument%20%28Indonesia%29">national monument</a>.
